Platform.Title: ecoli_3.0
Platform.Description: A microarray with 5760 spot features. Tip Configuration: Standard 16-tip Columns per Sector: 18 Rows per Sector: 20 Column Spacing: 1.1 Row Spacing: 1.1

Column.Name: GENE_SYMBOL
Column.Description: name of the gene represented by the sequence in the spot/feature

Column.Name: GENE_DESC
Column.Description: description of the gene represented by the sequence in the spot/feature

Platform.Title: ecoli_4.3
Platform.Description: A microarray with 4896 spot features. Tip Configuration: Standard 16-tip Columns per Sector: 18 Rows per Sector: 17 Column Spacing: 173 Row Spacing: 173

Column.Name: GENE_SYMBOL
Column.Description: name of the gene represented by the sequence in the spot/feature

Column.Name: GENE_DESC
Column.Description: description of the gene represented by the sequence in the spot/feature

Sample.Title: tnaA2,W3110 minimal +Trp 50ug/ml vs. dnaC genomic DNA
Sample.Description: Category: Amino Acid metabolism Subcategory: Tryptophan Scanning Software: ScanAlyze Software version: 2.24 Scanning parameters: Lot batch = a2_gmc

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: simple correlation coefficient of channel 1 and channel 2 pixels

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: aka LOG_RAT2N_MEAN, or log2 of ratio of CH2DN_MEAN and CH1DN_MEAN

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: standard deviation of fraction of pixels greater than CH1B_MEAN

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: standard deviation of fraction of pixels greater than CH2B_MEAN

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: slope of the simple regression line of channel 2 to channel 1 pixels

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: vertical, short-axis spot ellipse minimum pixel coordinate

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: vertical, short-axis spot ellipse maximum pixel coordinate

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: horizontal, long-axis spot ellipse minimum pixel coordinate

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: horizontal, long-axis spot ellipse maximum pixel coordinate

Series.Title: Tryptophan metabolism response in E. coli
Series.Summary: DNA microarray analysis of gene expression in response to physiological and genetic changes that affect tryptophan metabolism in Escherichia coli. We investigated the global changes in mRNA abundance in Escherichia coli elicited by various perturbations of tryptophan metabolism. To do so we printed DNA microarrays containing 95% of all annotated E. coli ORFs. We determined the expression profile that is predominantly dictated by the activity of the tryptophan repressor. Only three operons, trp, mtr, and aroH, exhibited appreciable expression changes consistent with this profile. The quantitative changes we observed in mRNA levels for the five genes of the trp operon were consistent within a factor of 2, with expectations based on established Trp protein levels. Several operons known to be regulated by the TyrR protein, aroF-tyrA, aroL, aroP, and aroG, were down-regulated on addition of tryptophan. TyrR can be activated by any one of the three aromatic amino acids. Only one operon, tnaAB, was significantly activated by the presence of tryptophan in the medium. We uncovered a plethora of likely indirect effects of changes in tryptophan metabolism on intracellular mRNA pools, most prominent of which was the sensitivity of arginine biosynthetic operons to tryptophan starvation. This study is detailed in Khodursky AB et al.(2000) Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 97:12170-5 Keywords: other
